triples.name: Vertebrate
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes vertebrate species populations as key indicators of extinction rates and biodiversity loss.

triples.name: Holocene extinction
triples.relevance: The paper discusses the ongoing sixth mass extinction event, also known as the Holocene extinction, caused by human activities.

triples.name: Extinction event
triples.relevance: The paper examines extinction events as a central phenomenon, comparing current extinction rates to historical mass extinctions.

triples.name: Extinction
triples.relevance: Extinction of species is the primary subject of the paper, analyzing population losses in critically endangered vertebrates.

triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: The paper emphasizes how species extinctions lead to biodiversity loss and regional biodiversity collapse in affected areas.
